repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:

Capability register logic is spread across 3 files.

Solution:

Consolidate (and simplify) logic into the client.

comment_data.body:
Looks like the methods on dynamic capabilities are in use:

https://github.com/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=dynamic_capabilities+language%3Alua&type=code

This would be a breaking change.
Could we keep the interface as is while just moving the logic into the client or same module at least?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -451,13 +449,13 @@ function Client.create(config)
     requests = {},
     attached_buffers = {},
     server_capabilities = {},
-    dynamic_capabilities = lsp._dynamic.new(id),
+    dynamic_capabilities = {},

comment_data.body:
I think if we want to remove this in 0.12 we need at least a replacement for `get`.  What fzf-lua, actions-preview and lspsaga are using this for looks quite reasonable to me and there isn't really an alternative.

So either only deprecate the inner properties except the `get` function, or we could drop the `_` prefix from `_get_dynamic_capability` and add docs for it.

Based on:

```lua
  local supports_resolve = utils.__HAS_NVIM_010
      -- runtime/lua/lsp/buf.lua:on_user_choice
      and (function()
        ---@var choice {action: lsp.Command|lsp.CodeAction, ctx: lsp.HandlerContext}
        local ms = require("vim.lsp.protocol").Methods
        local choice = self.opts._items[idx]
        local bufnr = assert(choice.ctx.bufnr, "Must have buffer number")
        local reg = client.dynamic_capabilities:get(ms.textDocument_codeAction, { bufnr = bufnr })
        return utils.tbl_get(reg or {}, "registerOptions", "resolveProvider")
            or client.supports_method(ms.codeAction_resolve)
      end)()
      -- prior to nvim 0.10 we could check `client.server_capabilities`
      or utils.tbl_get(client.server_capabilities, "codeActionProvider", "resolveProvider")
```

and 

```lua
function act:support_resolve(client)
  if vim.version().minor >= 10 then
    local reg = client.dynamic_capabilities:get('textDocument/codeAction', { bufnr = ctx.bufnr })
    return vim.tbl_get(reg or {}, 'registerOptions', 'resolveProvider')
      or client.supports_method('codeAction/resolve')
  end
  return vim.tbl_get(client.server_capabilities, 'codeActionProvider', 'resolveProvider')
end
```

To me look similar too:

```lua
client.supports_method(ms.codeAction_resolve, { bufnr = bufnr })
```

which for reference has the body:

```lua
--- @private
--- @param method string
--- @param opts? {bufnr: integer?}
function Client:_supports_method(method, opts)
  local required_capability = lsp._request_name_to_capability[method] -- { 'codeActionProvider', 'resolveProvider' },
  -- if we don't know about the method, assume that the client supports it.
  if not required_capability then
    return true
  end
  if vim.tbl_get(self.server_capabilities, unpack(required_capability)) then
    return true
  end
  if self:_method_supports_registration(method) then
    return self:_get_dynamic_capability(method, opts and opts.bufnr) ~= nil
  end
  return false
end
```

EDIT: oh wait, I see that's not the same.

We could and probably should make `supports_method` work in this particular case, but dynamic registration capabilities can contain other information too, so I think in any case its warranted to give plugins & users access to the information.

Ok, I've made a change to `client.support_method` so it works properly for resolve requests. WDYT?

---
EDIT:
> We could and probably should make supports_method work in this particular case,

You write this while I was implementing it.

> but dynamic registration capabilities can contain other information too, so I think in any case its warranted to give plugins & users access to the information.

Sure, I'm just seeing if we can provide a better interface for it.

comment_regular_data.body:
> Could you also add news entries about the deprecation and the supports_method extension ? Maybe also update the `@deprecated` annotation with an addition that points to the new function.

Sure, was going to do that.

> The get_method_registration_options name seems a bit long but I don't have any better idea - other than maybe directly exposing get_dynamic_capability (Could change it to include the check if the method supports registration - afaik that wouldn't be a breaking change as it is more of a sanity check anyway?)

Yeah, I don't like it either. Maybe just `get_registration_options(<method>)`?

---
EDIT: I fell sorry for the user `@deprecated`. They must get pinged so much.

Just looking at this more closely, I think the initial design here was wrong unless I've missed something.

The current design makes the assumption that each method/capability maps to exactly one registration. However, I don't see anywhere in the spec that suggests this is ok to do. From my interpretation it should be possible for a server to provide multiple registrations for the same method, with different `id`'s, and more importantly, different `documentSelectors`.

labels.description: changes that are not features or bugfixes
labels.name: refactor

title: refactor(lsp): fold in dynamic_registration code into the client
